creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
text: Although Daumier made his living as a caricaturist, he was also active as a painter, draftsman, and sculptor. He understood the disappointment of being refused by the annual Salon and the agony of not being respected as a serious artist.
title: Ungrateful nation, you will not have my masterpiece!
